intro: Bidens uhligii, commonly known as the yellow beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are often surrounded by bracts, and it has hairy, linear leaves that are typically arranged in pairs. Bidens uhligii is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and roadsides. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
